profile.text: The American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU) is a legal organization whose immigrant rights lawyer, Lee Gelernt, commented on the Trump administration's decision to send Venezuelan migrants from U.S. soil to Guantánamo Bay, Cuba, stating that it potentially raises legal issues^[article]. Gelernt is also the lead counsel in a lawsuit filed by legal aid organizations against the Trump administration, seeking to grant migrants held at Guantánamo Bay access to legal representation to challenge their detention^[article].

articles.article_title: Some Migrants Sent by Trump to Guantánamo Are Being Held by Military Guards

profile.text:
The CIA (Central Intelligence Agency) is a spy agency that operated covert prisons, known as black sites, at Guantánamo Bay between September 2003 and April 2004^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. These sites were code-named Maroon and Indigo^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. The agency reportedly sent alleged 9/11 conspirators and other "high-value detainees" to military detention at Guantánamo in September 2006 after holding them in secret spy agency custody for three to four years^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. A lawyer for Khalid Sheik Mohammed claimed that CIA Director Gina Haspel ran a secret agency outpost at Guantánamo, possibly a post-9/11 black site^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. The CIA declined to comment on this claim^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. John Kiriakou, a former CIA counterterrorism officer, stated he was offered the Guantánamo chief of base position in late 2002 or early 2003 but declined^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. Glenn Carle, a former CIA officer, indicated it was plausible that Gina Haspel could have been chief of base at Guantánamo^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. Ali Soufan, a former FBI agent, stated that during his time at Guantánamo, the CIA’s chief of base was a man^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262].

Chief of base is a CIA term for the officer in charge of a secret foreign outpost^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. A 2014 Senate study said the CIA had two such secret prisons at Guantánamo in 2003 and 2004^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262].

articles.article_title: Did CIA Director Gina Haspel run a black site at Guantánamo?

profile.text: The Coast Guard is a component of the Department of Homeland Security^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. As of Tuesday, the Coast Guard was guarding 45 migrants being held in a lower-security building on the other side of the Guantánamo Bay base^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461].

articles.article_title: Some Migrants Sent by Trump to Guantánamo Are Being Held by Military Guards

profile.text: The Defense department, along with the Homeland Security department, has been unwilling or unable to answer detailed questions regarding Venezuelan migrants sent to Guantánamo Bay^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. Officials for the Defense department have said little about the migrants other than their nationality and have described some as gang members, without offering evidence^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The U.S. Southern Command, which operates the terrorism prison, has been streaming staff and support personnel to the base since Trump's order on Jan. 29^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The Pentagon's prison operation put out a rush announcement seeking a Spanish-language interpreter in the Navy to do a 182-day stint at the prison^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461].

articles.article_title: Some Migrants Sent by Trump to Guantánamo Are Being Held by Military Guards

profile.text: The Defense departments, along with the Homeland Security department, have been either unwilling or unable to provide detailed answers regarding the situation of Venezuelan migrants sent to Guantánamo Bay^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. Officials for the Defense and Homeland Security departments have confirmed the nationality of the migrants and described some as gang members, without providing evidence^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The U.S. Southern Command, which operates the terrorism prison, has been streaming staff and support personnel to the base since January 29^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The Pentagon's prison operation sought a Spanish-language interpreter for a 182-day stint at the prison^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461].

articles.article_title: Some Migrants Sent by Trump to Guantánamo Are Being Held by Military Guards

profile.text: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) is responsible for border security and immigration enforcement^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. A spokesperson for the Department of Homeland Security, Tricia McLaughlin, stated that the agency had sent nearly 100 people to Guantánamo Bay, all with final deportation orders, and considered to have "committed a crime by entering the United States illegally"^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The group reportedly included "violent gang members and other high-threat illegal aliens"^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The Coast Guard, which is part of the Department of Homeland Security, is guarding 45 migrants being held in a lower-security building on the other side of the Guantánamo Bay base^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The Department of Homeland Security, along with the Defense Department, has been unwilling or unable to answer detailed questions about the migrants at Guantánamo Bay^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. On January 29, President Trump ordered the military and homeland security to prepare to expand a migrant operations center at Guantánamo Bay "for high-priority criminal aliens unlawfully present in the United States"^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. It is not known if or when the guards at Camp 6 would be replaced by or augmented with security personnel from homeland security^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461].

articles.article_title: Some Migrants Sent by Trump to Guantánamo Are Being Held by Military Guards

profile.text: The FBI (Federal Bureau of Investigation) is a law enforcement agency that conducted interrogations at Guantánamo Bay both before and after the September 11 attacks^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. Former FBI agent Ali Soufan conducted interrogations for the bureau at Guantánamo and stated that during his time at Gitmo, the CIA’s chief of base "was a man and he was really helpful and very good"^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. Soufan also stated that he does not recall seeing Gina Haspel in Guantánamo, but it is possible she visited Guantánamo while "she was chief of base in the black site where Nashiri was"^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262].

articles.article_title: Did CIA Director Gina Haspel run a black site at Guantánamo?

profile.text: The Department of Homeland Security is mentioned in the context of the Trump administration's transfer of Venezuelan migrants to Guantánamo Bay^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. A spokesperson for Homeland Security, Tricia McLaughlin, stated that the agency had sent nearly 100 people to Guantánamo Bay, all with final deportation orders, claiming they had committed a crime by entering the United States illegally and included violent gang members^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The Coast Guard, which is part of the Department of Homeland Security, is guarding 45 migrants in a lower-security building on the base^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. Officials for the Defense and Homeland Security departments have offered little information about the migrants other than their nationality and descriptions of some as gang members^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. Spokespeople for the Homeland Security and Defense departments have been unwilling or unable to answer detailed questions about what is happening to the migrants at the base^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The Trump administration ordered the military and homeland security to prepare to expand a migrant operations center at Guantánamo Bay on January 29^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. It is not known if or when the guards at Camp 6 would be replaced by or augmented with security personnel from homeland security^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461].

articles.article_title: Some Migrants Sent by Trump to Guantánamo Are Being Held by Military Guards

profile.text: Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) is a law enforcement agency that detains migrants^[{abc123}]. According to the Trump administration, ICE was responsible for the custody of Venezuelan migrants sent to the U.S. military base in Guantánamo Bay, Cuba^[{abc123}]. However, military guards and medics were handling the migrants in practice^[{abc123}]. ICE sent nearly 100 people to Guantánamo Bay, all with final deportation orders, according to a homeland security spokesperson^[{abc123}]. These individuals were considered to have "committed a crime by entering the United States illegally," and the group included "violent gang members and other high-threat illegal aliens"^[{abc123}]. Not all migrants in ICE detention entered the United States illegally; some requested asylum at the border but were rejected^[{abc123}]. As of Tuesday, ICE had sent a total of 98 men to Guantánamo^[{abc123}]. The criterion for transfer to Guantánamo is currently Venezuelans in ICE custody^[{abc123}]. The Trump administration has told congressional staff members that only six ICE officials are working on the migrant detention operation at Guantánamo^[{abc123}]. One person familiar with the operation said that only two ICE officials were working inside Camp 6^[{abc123}].

articles.article_title: Some Migrants Sent by Trump to Guantánamo Are Being Held by Military Guards

profile.text: King University is a university located in Tennessee^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. Gail Helt, a former CIA analyst, is currently a professor of Security and Intelligence Studies at King University^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262].

articles.article_title: Did CIA Director Gina Haspel run a black site at Guantánamo?

profile.text: McClatchy is a news organization^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. Former CIA counterterrorism officer John Kiriakou spoke to McClatchy^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. Rita Radostitz also spoke to McClatchy^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. This story was originally published January 8, 2019 at 9:55 AM^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262].

articles.article_title: Did CIA Director Gina Haspel run a black site at Guantánamo?

profile.text: The Navy is mentioned in the context of a Spanish-language interpreter being sought for a 182-day stint at the prison in Guantánamo Bay^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The interpreter is needed for the Pentagon's prison operation, which already has Arabic language linguists on staff for detainees in the war on terrorism^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The Navy base in southeast Cuba is where ICE sent a total of 98 men as of Tuesday^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461].

articles.article_title: Some Migrants Sent by Trump to Guantánamo Are Being Held by Military Guards

profile.text: The Pentagon is mentioned in the context of releasing portions of a transcript on a war court website following an intelligence review^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. The transcript concerns a secret hearing held at Guantánamo on Nov. 16 regarding the alleged architect of the Sept. 11 attacks^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. The Pentagon is also mentioned as the location of one of the attacks on Sept. 11, 2001^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. The article also notes that the CIA operated two black sites at Guantánamo in 2003 and 2004, separate from the Pentagon’s Guantánamo prison known as Camp Delta^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262].

articles.article_title: Did CIA Director Gina Haspel run a black site at Guantánamo?

profile.text: The Pulitzer Center on Crisis Reporting is an organization that partnered in the production of the article.^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]

articles.article_title: Did CIA Director Gina Haspel run a black site at Guantánamo?

profile.text: The Senate Intelligence Committee conducted a study in 2014 of the CIA’s network of secret overseas prisons, known as black sites^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. The study was 6,200-pages long and is referred to as the torture report^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. The public portion of the report mentions that the CIA operated two black sites at Guantánamo, code named Maroon and Indigo, from September 2003 to April 2004^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262].

articles.article_title: Did CIA Director Gina Haspel run a black site at Guantánamo?

profile.text: *The New York Times* is a news organization that obtained and published the names of 53 men being held in Camp 6 at Guantánamo Bay^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The list was of migrants who the Trump administration had sent to the U.S. military base in Guantánamo Bay, Cuba^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. This article originally appeared in *The New York Times*^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461].

articles.article_title: Some Migrants Sent by Trump to Guantánamo Are Being Held by Military Guards

profile.text: The Tren de Aragua gang is mentioned in connection with Venezuelan migrants being detained at Guantánamo Bay^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The Trump administration officials portrayed the would-be deportees as associates of the Tren de Aragua gang^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. However, the article states that officials have not specified the basis for this accusation for each man, and the *New York Times* could not independently verify the claims^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461].

articles.article_title: Some Migrants Sent by Trump to Guantánamo Are Being Held by Military Guards

profile.text: The U.S. Southern Command operates the terrorism prison at Guantánamo Bay^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. Since January 29, it has been streaming staff and support personnel to the base following an order from the Trump administration to prepare to expand a migrant operations center at Guantánamo Bay for "high-priority criminal aliens unlawfully present in the United States"^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461].

articles.article_title: Some Migrants Sent by Trump to Guantánamo Are Being Held by Military Guards

profile.text: The *U.S. military* operates the U.S. military base in Guantánamo Bay, Cuba^[abc123]. Troops are guarding Venezuelan migrants sent to the base by the Trump administration^[abc123]. Military guards and medics are handling the migrants, who are legally in the custody of Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)^[abc123]. The U.S. Southern Command, which operates the terrorism prison, has been streaming staff and support personnel to the base since January 29^[abc123]. The Pentagon's prison operation sought a Spanish-language interpreter for a 182-day stint at the prison^[abc123]. Until recently, the military held al-Qaida suspects in Camp 6, a prison building where 53 migrants are now being held^[abc123]. The Supreme Court has ruled that the government has lawful authority to hold al-Qaida suspects in indefinite wartime detention at Guantánamo, under a law passed by Congress that authorizes the use of military force against the perpetrators of the Sept. 11 attacks^[abc123].

articles.article_title: Some Migrants Sent by Trump to Guantánamo Are Being Held by Military Guards

profile.text: The U.S. Navy operates a base at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. This base includes a terror-detention center^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262], and the *Pentagon* released portions of a transcript on a war court website related to activities at Guantanamo^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. The military prison commanders' names at Guantanamo were disclosed, unlike those who served as CIA chief of base^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. In September 2006, the CIA sent alleged 9/11 conspirators and other “high-value detainees” to military detention at Guantánamo^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. The trial judge is Marine Col. Keith Parrella^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262].

articles.article_title: Did CIA Director Gina Haspel run a black site at Guantánamo?

profile.text: The USS Cole is mentioned in the context of the alleged USS Cole bomber, Abd al Rahim al Nashiri, whose interrogation in Thailand Gina Haspel reportedly oversaw^[fb46f019-6ead-40d1-a9db-0f6198d5e262]. The article does not provide further details about the USS Cole itself.

articles.article_title: Did CIA Director Gina Haspel run a black site at Guantánamo?

profile.text: al-Qaida is a terrorist organization whose suspects were previously held in Camp 6 at Guantánamo Bay^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The Supreme Court has ruled that the government has the authority to hold al-Qaida suspects in indefinite wartime detention at Guantánamo^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461], under a law passed by Congress that authorizes the use of military force against the perpetrators of the Sept. 11 attacks^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461]. The number of al-Qaida detainees at Guantánamo Bay is now down to 15 after transfers late in the Biden administration^[17fe80a6-5dc1-4e41-a7b5-eb9f56a64461].

articles.article_title: Some Migrants Sent by Trump to Guantánamo Are Being Held by Military Guards
